Job_Title: Software Engineer (App Engine / PaaS), Cloud Infrastructure
Job_Descriptions: TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. The Cloud Infrastructure team, based in Singapore, supports many of our star products and core business lines, serving hundreds of millions of users every day. We actively embrace open source and innovative software/hardware architecture, building a series of infrastructure to ensure the best R&D practices and enable the overall development of the company. Relying on the cloud native environment, PaaS team creates a simple and easy-to-use service hosting platform for developers, improving research and development efficiency whilst reducing service maintenance costs. PaaS comes from a service perspective, connecting developers with the cloud native environment, shielding developers from the learning costs of kubernetes, and providing functions such as service hosting, code release, capacity adjustment, as well as operation and maintenance governance. PaaS has been integrated into our development ecosystem, helping to build service discovery, quota management, access control, monitoring, alarm, and log transmission. At present, our PaaS platform has hosted most of the company's online services and is in a leading position in the industry in terms of the number of services and cluster size. We look forward to those who are interested in challenging tasks and are willing to embrace cloud native computing. Responsibilities Design and develop application engines serving billions of requests; Design TikTok and its affiliates' business-oriented architecture, and construct an efficient online/offline service hosting platform; Provide solutions for internal product lines, and integrate with business-oriented frameworks; Design and develop key components of PaaS. Qualifications Bachelor's degree or above in computer science or a related field; Good programming habits and proficiency in Go/Python; Practical experience with large-scale distributed system development and maintenance; Excellent modeling and problem solving skills; Familiarity with microservice architecture and microservice governance; Familiarity with the best practices of R&D process. Preferred Qualifications Experience with cloud computing development; Familiarity with Docker, Kubernetes, GAE, SAE, etc.; Experience with full stack development and private cloud platform components.

Job_Title: Software Engineer (RPC Framework / Service Mesh) - Cloud Infrastructure
Job_Descriptions: TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. The Cloud Infrastructure team, based in Singapore, supports many of our star products and core business lines, serving hundreds of millions of users every day. We actively embrace open source and innovative software/hardware architecture, building a series of infrastructure to ensure the best R&D practices and enable the overall development of the company. The Microservice Framework team focuses on in-depth research on programming languages, RPC frameworks, and high-performance middleware. We provide the company with research and development frameworks, high-performance middleware, service mesh, and unified SOA Governance platforms. Among them, the Golang framework (KiteX) has been applied to tens of thousands of services carrying over billions of QPS in total and is at the forefront of the industry in terms of performance and scalability. Service Mesh and our traffic management platforms cover most of the company's businesses. Responsibilities Design and develop microservice RPC frameworks for Golang/Java/Python/Rust; Design and develop our Service Mesh system; Design and develop our traffic management platforms. Qualifications Proficient in one or more programming languages such as Golang/Java/Python/Rust; Strong interest in technologies such as RPC frameworks/Service Mesh/traffic management systems; In-depth understanding of RPC principles and frameworks such as gRPC/bRPC/dubbo/thrift; In-depth understanding of the key areas of microservice governance and its implementation. Preferred Qualifications At least 3 years of relevant experience; Experience in contributing to open source projects; Practical experience with Service Mesh systems.

Job_Descriptions: Job Description At Paragon, we are much more than just a karate school, a sport, or a fun activity. We are a family that creates Superheroes. Our Australian School is growing, and we are looking for young, energetic, enthusiastic and passionate individuals to join us as we expand into Singapore. We teach our students that they can positively influence the world by focusing on their behaviour. Through our innovative programs, each of our students learns to unleash their inner Superhero to become the best version of themselves that they can be. At Paragon, we aim to make each class a positive, rewarding and motivating experience. We are a family school with a friendly, inclusive and welcoming community, providing exceptional karate training to students of all ages, backgrounds, and abilities. Regardless of ability, we believe that any person should be given the opportunity to participate fully, and our programs are designed to ensure this. ParagonInc Singapore's expansion has the primary objective of opening a SuperHero School in Singapore focused on a Martial Arts program for children aged 5-11. In addition, we will expand into teenager, adults, and pre-school aged children post the initial launch. We are looking for instructors to join us on this journey from the beginning! The offer: We are holding a comprehensive selection activity starting March 1st 2022, for two months. 8-10 candidates will be selected to join this selection activity. Candidates will receive two months of free training to learn the basics of Paragon Martial Arts. Following this, we will select 3-4 instructors for paid positions. - Join two months of free lessons (twice a week) to learn the basics of Paragon Martial Arts (March 1st to April 30th). - After two months, the head instructor will select Instructors to become part of the Paragon Instructor Team in a paid position. - If you are not selected as an instructor in the first two months, you are welcome to continue training with us at a reduced fee rate. Ongoing benefits: - Instructors will continue to receive free martial arts training. - Opportunities to travel to our sister school in Australia Applicants can be current university students, new graduates or mid-career. The successful applicant will be able to provide evidence of working with children and (preferably) martial arts. Overall Purpose and Objective of This Position: The Instructor positions at Paragon Martial Arts are a critical role responsible for maximizing the experience that all students have in class and with our School and ensuring the students learn the curriculum and see positive changes in their lives. This includes teaching class, leading by example and ensuring the space at Paragon Martial Arts reflects the high standards we demand of our School. Roles and Responsibilities: Leading Class – Instructors must be capable of leading a class (you will be trained in all aspects of Martial Arts required). This involves following the curriculum plan and designing and implementing fun and engaging classes that help every student make progress towards their goals. To do this, the Instructor must understand each student's individual goals. Student engagement – The number one role of an instructor is to ensure that every student in a class is actively engaged in the class and that classes are exciting. This should be done through frequent minor adjustments in behaviour through positive means. Every student and person who walks into our School should be made to feel like they are a valued member of our community, of our tight family. You will also be required to run specific drills explained to you by the Instructor. Cleaning – As part of providing our students and families with an experience that surpasses all expectations, it is important that the environment we train in is kept Super clean. Keeping the School clean is the job of every Paragon employee. Leading by example – You must maintain the standard of a superhero both in and outside of karate. You must maintain a minimum of two classes per week of training. You will be asked to hold yourself to a higher standard than others would. Any public social profiles or private ones that have any members of Paragon Martial Arts on them must be maintained at a standard acceptable of someone working with children, for example, no swearing, drunken photos, racist comments or anything demeaning to anyone. Anything that would lower our families' impression of you or the School should be avoided. Student Retention – An essential component of an Instructors role is ensuring all students are continually improving. You will also be involved in helping create a strong relationship between the student and Paragon Martial Arts. You will need to get to know all of our students remembering names is an absolute must. You will also be required to write at least one Great Job card per night of teaching. Sales – As a member of the Paragon Team, it is expected that you will assist with bringing in new students. This may be by referring new students, talking about our programs to people, or helping with getting advertising material out. You will also be required to do basic cash register activities selling uniforms, merchandise and events. You are also expected to interact with Paragon posts through social media and help share the message with your social circle. Expectations: The Instructor is expected at all times to: 1. Lead by example 2. Train minimum two times per week 3. Attend all instructor training sessions 4. Maintain excellent knowledge of the curriculum they have covered. 5. Be punctual on all commitments 6. Conduct themselves with a highly positive, energetic and contagious attitude 7. Be constantly adding value to the student experience 8. Raise the quality of instruction at Paragon Martial Arts 9. Be Punctual to all commitments 10. Maintain a high energy high expectations class. 11. Follow up with the manager or the family on any students missing class 12. Maintain student numbers in class 13. Bring in a minimum of 2 new students per month Characteristics and Skills Sets: 1. Strong and positive attitude 2. Hunger to learn 3. Energetic 4. Martial Arts Interest 5. Ability to interact and talk to children 6. Ability to interact and talk to families 7. Desire to do more than is expected 8. Strong teaching skills with a desire to continually learn how to improve 9. Ability to deliver the curriculum in an exciting manner Reporting Channel: The Instructor reports to the Director of ParagonInc Please apply now if you would like to be considered for the selection process. TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. The Cloud Infrastructure team, based in Singapore, supports many of our star products and core business lines, serving hundreds of millions of users every day. We actively embrace open source and innovative software/hardware architecture, building a series of infrastructure to ensure the best R&D practices and enable the overall development of the company. The messaging middleware team is responsible for the research and development of TikTok and its affiliates' messaging platform. We manage the Message Queue systems of all products such as Douyin, TikTok, Toutiao, Xigua Video and Hotsoon. We covering an industry-leading data scale. Because we are extremely sensitive to the stability and cost of external services, we have self-developed the message queue BMQ. BMQ is based on the separation of storage and computing architecture, compatible with the kafka protocol. In addition to pursuing extreme stability and cost, we also actively explore and expand business scenarios, tapping the potential value of original log data, and accessing batch computing engines. Responsibilities Responsible for the R&D of our messaging platform; Responsible for the R&D of our next generation computing and storage separation architecture on a trillion-level messaging platform; Responsible for cost optimization, stability improvement and performance improvement of the system; Responsible for analyzing business requirements and expanding the features of the messaging platform. Qualifications A proficient software developer skilled in at least one general purpose programming language, such as C/C++/Go/Python; Familiar with operating system, network, computer architecture and other related knowledge; Experience in developing large-scale, high-performance and highly available distributed systems; Familiar with at least one of these MQ systems or other similar systems (e.g. Distributed streaming processing platform Kafka, real-time distributed messaging platform NSQ, high-performance distributed messaging and streaming platform RocketMQ, distributed messaging system Pulsar, etc.); Experience in system performance analysis and optimization. Preferred Qualifications At least 3 years of relevant experience.

Life at Grab At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia. Get to know the Team Grabber Technology Solutions (GTS) aims to be a technology leader that provides predictive and seamless experiences to all Grab employees (Grabbers). We are a diverse team of technology practitioners looking to outserving Grabbers with positive, personalised IT experiences, and we are looking for individuals with similar customer-centric and innovative values to join our growing team Get to know the Role Reporting to the Senior Manager of Finance Systems, this role will be responsible for the delivery of Grab’s finance system enhancements and deployments. The candidate will be primarily responsible for capturing, analyzing and estimating business requirements and translating them into Oracle Cloud ERP solution architecture that fits within the business environment and business objectives. You will lead complex functional/process analysis and facilitate workshops with senior resources and subject matter experts. The Day-to-Day Activities: Provide solution architecture domain guidance, expertise, and support across business systems and technologies. Enable business agility and innovation via a flexible architecture which caters for rapid development and implementation cycles. Creates architectural designs to guide and contextualize solution development across products, services, projects, and systems (including applications, technologies, processes and information). Takes responsibility for investigative work to determine requirements and specify effective business processes, through improvements in the cloud technical domain. Work effectively with internal stakeholders, vendors, consultants, technical staff and integration leads across discovery, design, implementation, integration and test phases of enhancements. Support and coordinate User Acceptance Testing (UAT) performed by business and external stakeholders. Be a driver of change for Finance and Procurement & GTS to continuously improve our ability to serve Grabbers; includes identifying gaps in processes, data lifecycle or new relevant releases in platform offerings. The Must-Haves: In depth knowledge of functional domains such as: General Ledger, Accounts Payables, Accounts Receivables, Fixed Assets, Advance Collections, Cash Management, Financial Accounting Hub. Expertise in supporting Testing, Defects Analysis and Fixing in sync with product development and support. Extensive knowledge of the Oracle solution and keep abreast with the product roadmap. Ability to identify the appropriate software architecture based on the requirements and design elements contained in a system specification. Ability to analyze software requirements, define solution parameters and specifications. Understand prioritization of enhancements e.g. what should come first to avoid risks/impacts. Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills and the ability to work with both internal and external stakeholders at all levels The Nice-to-Haves: Software developer background in areas Knowledge and direct experience with Oracle EPM Applications. Knowledge of COSO & COBIT frameworks Our Commitment We are committed to building diverse teams and creating an inclusive workplace that enables all Grabbers to perform at their best, regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity or sexual orientation and other attributes that make each Grabber unique. About Grab Grab is the leading superapp platform in Southeast Asia, providing everyday services that matter to consumers. Today, the Grab app has been downloaded onto millions of mobile devices, giving users access to over 9 million drivers, merchants, and agents. Grab offers a wide range of on-demand services in the region, including mobility, food, package and grocery delivery services, mobile payments, and financial services across 428 cities in eight countries. Join us today to drive Southeast Asia forward, together.

PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES: Control access to company facilities for the safety of all employees. Inspect employees and vendors upon entry to ensure that unauthorized items are not brought in and those items are not removed without proper clearance. Respond to emergencies and resolve conflict when required. Prepare incident reports Monitor the Security System for the safety and security of all employees JOB CONTENT: Report directly to the Security and Maintenance Supervisor for the shift assigned. Perform duties as a roving or stationary security officer as assigned by the Supervisor. Assist the Supervisor in accomplishing their duties, tasks and objectives. This is including but not limited to access control, daily log maintenance, interior and exterior patrols, alarm response, opening and closing of the facility. Maintain a high level of attention to details, act as a team player while maintaining discipline in executing their duties and respect the company’s Security Officer Code of Conduct. Maintain vigilance while on duty for the protection of the facility, employees and all property owned or leased by Future Electronics Corporation. Control access to the building through the turnstile operation and ensure that all persons entering and exiting the building have either done so by use of an employee access card, or have been manually signed in by the security officer. The manual signing in of employees includes issuing a temporary badge and ensuring that the register of employees without badges is duly completed. Monitor and react promptly to all alarm systems including Fire Panels, ADT Alarm and CCTV system. Ensure that all employees wear their Employee Identification Card at all times and that the card is visible. Any employee not wearing their card must be reported in the Daily Journal. Maintain the Daily Journal and make the appropriate entries. Prepare incident reports and other related administrative forms with the knowledge and direction of the Shift Leader. Check fire emergency equipment such as fire extinguishers, fire hose cabinets and sprinkler valves. Know fire alarm procedures; zone and alarm locations; and reset procedures. Look for safety hazards to include electrical or water conditions. Alert Facility Maintenance of any hazards or discrepancies that may require immediate corrective action. Ensure that these discrepancies are reported to the shift leader and are noted and logged in the Daily Journal. Review and learn all security operating procedures (SOP Manual). Review security memos, pass-on messages, or other directives. Perform escorts to contractors, vendors, and other visitors as necessary. Ensure that outside contractors performing duties within the facility adhere to internal security procedures and that these procedures are maintained and followed at all times. Ensure proper wear and display of contractor ID badges. JOB REQUIREMENTS: Valid SLRD certification is a must Dedicated team player with the ability to work and communicate effectively Ability to read and understand English Flexible/adaptable to changing environment Effective in relating in an appropriate, positive manner with peers and supervisors. Self-motivated with the capacity to complete tasks unsupervised Must have basic software skills, such as MS Excel and Word

Job_Title: Staff Full Stack Engineer (Engineering, Data and Machine Learning Team)
Job_Descriptions: Get to Know our Team: The Data department oversees all of Agoda's data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company's culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward. The Opportunity In this role, you will beinvolved in the design,architecture, coding, testing and, operations of our global-scale software systems to support the innovation and technical excellence that the rapidly changing field of online travel requires. In this Role, you'll get to Design, develop and operate the solutions used by millions of people every day Big Data and Machine Learning processing pipelines Data-Driven changes to the application Constantly look for ways to improve our products, code-base and development practices Write great code and help others write great code Drive Technical decisions in the organization What you'll Need to Succeed Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Information Systems/Engineering/related field or relevant experience 6+ years of industry experience, including software development experience Strong coding ability Experience or willingness to learn JavaScript/Scala/Spark/Kafka and relatedtechnologies (if not already known) Able to quickly and effectively read code Good understanding of algorithms and data structures Ability to separate hype from reality It's Great if you have Any experience with Big Data technologies/tools Any experience with JavaScript client and Server-side technologies is a plus Strong experience in JVM languages (Java / Scala in particular) Experience working with Lambda Architectures Experience working with open source products Working in an agile environment using test-driven methodologies. Experience with tools like Git, Docker and Kubernetes A few of the technologies we use: React, Scala, Akka, Play, Spark, RabbitMQ, Kafka, Couchbase, Hadoop, Impala, Elasticsearch, Kibana, Grafana, MSSQL, Kubernetes

Get to Know our Team: In Agoda's Back End Engineering department, we build the scalable, fault-tolerant systems and APIs that host our core business logic. Our systems cover all major areas of our business: inventory and pricing, product information, customer data, communications, partner data, booking systems, payments, and more. These mission-critical systems change frequently with dozens of releases per day, so we must employ state-of-the-art CI/CD and testing techniques in order to make sure everything works without any downtime. We also ensure that our systems are self-healing, responding gracefully to extreme loads or unexpected input. In order to accomplish this, we use state-of-the-art languages like Scala and Go, data technologies like Kafka and Aerospike, and agile development practices. Most importantly though, we hire great people from all around the world and empower them to be successful. Whether it's building new projects like Flights and Packages or reimagining our existing business, you'll make a big impact as part of the Back End Engineering team. The Opportunity: The Engineering Manager role at Agoda is one of the most significant and challenging roles at the company. The right candidate is both extremely hands on - technically excellent, with solid engineering principles - and exhibits strong leadership and people development skills. We are looking for world class development managers to lead one or more of our engineering teams. In This Role, You'll Get to Lead team of 5 to 12 energetic developers Drive design and architecture of the system Create a robust, scalable and blazing-fast API. Drive the execution of the team toward the vision. Visionary and pragmatic. Grow and coach team members. Always challenge team to be higher performer. Work closely with product owner to provide technical direction Technologies we love Big Data technologies (Hadoop, Kafka, Impala) Micro-services developmentlanguages &technologies(E.g.: Scala/Akka) Relational database (E.g.: SQL Server, Postgres) NoSQL database technologies (E.g.: Cassandra, Couchbase, Aerospike) Message queueing technologies (E.g.: Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, MSMQ) Continuous Integration (Teamcity / Gitlab) Performance and load testing What You'll Need to Succeed Passionate about technology and building software 5-10 years experience in software development and a mix of theabove-mentionedtechnologies. At least 3 years experience in a leadership/influencer position: team lead, development manager or architect. Must have worked in an Agile environment and understands Scrum It's Great if You Have Familiarity with travel industry and rate system is a plus Experience in ML development is a plus

Job_Title: Staff Software Engineer – Full Stack (Singapore based)
Job_Descriptions: Get to Know our Team: The Full Stack Engineering Department builds the Agoda web and app products. We have several teams in front-end focusing on different aspects of our products including accommodations, flights, payments, marketing, post-booking services, and more. Agoda's marketplace is the world. We build localized and optimized user experiences at scale on every major internet platform. These include our mobile websites, native apps, and desktop sites. We hire people from around the world who have a passion for using technology to create and implement the best user experiences. Our teams work on the full stack and build end-to-end systems including user interfaces, APIs, backend systems, and database systems. Our products are always evolving and under experimentation. We accomplish this by having an amazing degree of automation, CI/CD systems, and use a modularized approach. As we are data driven and measure our results, we continually innovate and improve our work. We are looking for the next great talent who strives to learn and grow and has a standard of excellence, strong sense of ownership, and great technical skills. The Opportunity: We are looking for key contributors to our industry leading front-end websites. You'll be working on products which have evolved tremendously over the past several years to become the global market leader. You'll be using the most current technologies and best practices to accomplish our goals.Our typical day involves the creation of new end to end systems, building advanced architectures, creation of new features on our high uptime / frequently published websites and apps, development of fast and reliable automated testing systems and working in a culture that is always looking to improve our quality, tools, and efficiency. In this Role, you'll get to: Lead development of features, experiments, technical projects and complex systems Be a technical architect, mentor, and driver towards the right technology Build high volume websites with current technologies including TS, React, and GraphQL Continue to evolve our architecture and build better software Be a major contributor to our agile and scrum practices Get involved with full stack engineering and collaborate with server, other client, and infrastructure technical team members to build the best solution What you'll Need to Succeed: At least 7 years of experience developing web applications in client-side frameworks such as React, Angular, VueJS, etc. S. in Computer Science or quantitative fieldM.S. preferred Working experience with agile, analytics, A/B testing, GIT Flow Excellent HTML/CSS skills - you understand not only how to build the data, but how to make it look great too 3-5+ years experience developing performance-critical applications that run in a production environment using one of the backend languages/frameworks such as .NET, .NET Core, Java, Scala, NodeJS, Go or Python. Excellent understanding of object-oriented JavaScript, TypeScript You love new technologies and approaches and want to use the best tools available. We want people who can help us continually evolve our stack. Great communication and coordination skills Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving skills You have a good command of the English language. It's Great if you have: Knowledge in physical architecture at scale, building resilient, no single point of failures, highly available solutions. Knowledge in one or more of the following: NoSQL technologies (CouchBase, ElasticSearch, Redis), Queueing system experience (Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, MSMQ). Knowledge and hands on experience in CI/CD solutions would be a plus Excellent understanding of object-oriented JavaScript, TypeScript Strong experience in all aspects of client-side performance optimization, Extremely proficient in modern mobile and server coding and design practices. For example, Clean Code, SOLID principals, and TDD. Experience in multiple front-end platforms including iOS, Android, Web, and API services Have worked on an app or internet company that is at scale with large numbers of users and transactions per second Have experience in a data driven company with experience analyzing and working with Big Data Lead teams and greenfield projects solving large system problems Worked on global projects serving world markets with distributed data centers and localization of the front end and data

Decathlon is present in Singapore since 2013 with the first store in Bedok district in 2016. Our missions to make sports accessible to the masses and satisfy customers have resonated well in Singapore, resulting in the rapid expansion of the company. Currently we have 5 “Experience” stores and 7 “Click & Collect” stores in Singapore. We are in search of talent who are sport-passionate and those who relish the challenge of thinking outside the box and breaking new barriers in retailing experience and omni-channel operations. As a Retail Sport Specialist your role is to ensure all customers leave our stores ‘satisfied or satisfied’. From a friendly and professional welcome through to a unique online and offline retail experience. You will enjoy sharing your passion in sports with our customers. Your role is to always deliver a 5-star experience for our customers. A people person who is prepared to go the extra mile. Problem solver with excellent communication skills. About HashiCorp At HashiCorp, we’re building a generation-defining infrastructure software company, powered by our core principles and a growing team of talented, committed professionals working together to help organizations seamlessly transition to and operate in the cloud. To help our customers adopt our products quickly and help fuel our company growth to support them, we’re looking for an experienced growth marketing manager to support and grow our APJ market. Work with ops, sales, and marketing teams to ensure we’re generating the right type and volume of sales leads and collecting high-quality data to understand performance Build processes and frameworks that will scale with a growing organization Publicize and share relevant insights from experiments, tactics, and projects You may be a good fit for our team if you have… Experience working directly with Sales Leadership and Sales Representatives on campaigns in the field Experience identifying target audiences, working with customer segmentation and personalization, and creating end-to-end account campaign strategies Previous experience marketing to a technical audience of practitioners, and decision makers. Experience generating demand and running account plays at an enterprise B2B company Experienced understanding of SEO, Marketo, Google Analytics, Salesforce, and other key web technology and analytics tools/platforms Strong analytical skills with an ability to compile and analyze campaign data to inform decisions Experience partnering with GTM and sales on pipeline development. Job Purpose Looking for Cloud Engineering Lead with strong technical background to manage on-premise Cloud Platform. You are responsible for leading and forming a team of Platform Reliability Engineers (PRE), Site Reliability Engineers (SRE), DevOps Engineers and Security Engineers on the implementation of new and enhanced services on Cloud Platform. You will be working closely with the Cloud Platform Director and Cloud Engagement Lead to define and implement technical solutions on the cloud platform to fulfil Group IT Cloud strategy. You will be responsible for all technical aspects related to the cloud platform, including implementation and operation of IaaS, CaaS, PaaS, DevOps Pipeline and Cloud Management Platform. You will be responsible in defining and enforcing PRE, SRE and DevOps practices for the cloud platform. The Job Lead a team of engineers of different domains to implement new and enhanced services the cloud platform. Be the solution architect for the cloud platform, which includes IaaS, CaaS, PaaS, DevOps Pipeline and Cloud Management Platform. Work closely with Cloud Portfolio Director and the Cloud Engagement Lead to derive and implement a technical roadmap that is align with the IT architecture and cloud strategy. Operate the cloud platform and ensure the stability, reliability and resiliency. Plan, mobilize and manage resources within the Cloud Engineering Team optimally to execute against plan(s). Establish PRE, SRE and DevOps practices for the Cloud Engineering Team. Support and enable projects to be on boarded to the cloud platform. Ensure compliance to both Group IT and Corporate principles and policies. Drive change and adoption for continuous improvement to optimise delivery processes. Train, coach and mentor engineers. As part of the leadership team, work with key stakeholders to proactively shape the organisation’s culture and conduct environment that is aligned to the organization’s Core Values. Champion culture and conduct behavioral expectations within the Department/Division. Takes accountability in considering business and regulatory compliance risks and takes appropriate steps to mitigate the risks. Maintains awareness of industry trends on regulatory compliance, emerging threats and technologies in order to understand the risk and better safeguard the company. Highlights any potential concerns /risks and proactively shares best risk management practices. Our Requirements Relevant degree level qualification or equivalent. Minimum of 10 years of technical experience in both IT software development projects and operational IT operations system support roles. Minimum 10 years working experience managing an on premise and public cloud environment. Strong technical and business acumen with the ability to lead teams with multiple discipline representation. Experience in design various components in a cloud environment such as IaaS, CaaS, PaaS, DevOps pipeline and cloud management platform. Experience managing engineers related to cloud platform setup and operations. Understanding and hands-on experience of infrastructure management using Infrastructure-as-Code. Understanding of IaaS technologies. eg. vRealize Suite. Understanding and hands-on of container platform management, e.g. Dockers and/or Kubernetes, HELM, Openshift, Pivotal. Worked with Agile and waterfall delivery methodologies and understands how Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) can be automated. Hands on experience working in a Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) environment with strong appreciation of change/version control process and methodologies. Hands on Experience with Automation tools (E.g. Selenium, SOAPUI, Bamboo, Jenkins, Ansible, Marvin, Github, Bitbucket, Nexus etc.). Experience working in a large-scale enterprise IT environment involving hybrid architectures with complex and heterogeneous systems integration. Knowledge of cloud application design principles such as 12 factor app. Knowledge of ITIL is an advantage. Understanding of platform integration/architecture in areas of microservices, containerization, serverless, and multiple cloud management. Understanding of integration of on-premise infrastructure with public cloud service provider. Experience in use of project management and collaboration tools is required (E.g. Microsoft Project, Confluence, Jira Software, Kanban Boards, etc.) Working knowledge of application design frameworks, UML or equivalent design artefacts is required. Working experience in a financial services industry and/or operating under strict regulatory constraints is an advantage. Problem solver with ability to see things in multiple angles, constantly challenge the norm and constantly looking for better solutions to problems. Strong presenter being able to articulate differentiated value to a wide range of audiences from senior management to technical teams. Strong negotiation and influencing skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Able to make judgements calls in a fast changing environment with limited or ambiguous information. Demonstrates alignment with the organisation’s core values through expected behaviours. High level of integrity, takes accountability of work and good attitude over teamwork. Takes initiative to improve current state of things and adaptable to embrace new changes. About Great Eastern Established in 1908, Great Eastern places customers at the heart of everything we do. Our legacy extends beyond our products and services to our culture, which is defined by our core values and how we work. As champions of Integrity, Initiative and Involvement, our core values act as a compass, guiding and inspiring us to embrace the behaviours associated with each value, upholding our promise to our customers - to continue doing our best for them in a sustainable manner. We work collaboratively with our stakeholders to look for candidates who exhibit or have the potential to embrace our core values and associated behaviours, as these are the key traits that we expect from our employees as they develop their careers with us. We embrace inclusivity, giving all employees an equal opportunity to shine and play their role in exploring possibilities to deliver innovative insurance solutions. Since 2018, Great Eastern has been a signatory to the United Nations (UN) Principles of Sustainable Insurance. Our sustainability approach around environmental, social, and governance (ESG) considerations play a key role in every business decision we make. We are committed to being a sustainability-driven company to achieve a low-carbon economy by managing the environmental footprint of our operations and incorporating ESG considerations in our investment portfolios; improving people’s lives by actively helping customers live healthier, better and longer; and drive responsible business practices through material ESG risk management. To all recruitment agencies: Great Eastern does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our email or our employees. We will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
